WorkItem.Description:
I thought I saw an issue somewhere about this already, but on search I could no longer find it.
 
In the forlorn search for that elusive high score I saw once and never again, I saved off some high scoring sets when I saw them. However, in going back to my main file and equipping the exact same items/enchants/gems manually, I get nowhere near the same score. The only difference between the two should be that I removed a lot of items/enchants/gems I was fairly certain were not used in that really high score I was trying to re-find.
 
Here is the high-score file...
WorkItem.Summary: Different results via optimizer vs manual equip

Comments.Message: Are you saying that the two files have different scores, but identical gear/buffs/talents/options/etc?
(If that's what you're saying, we definitely want to know about it, but please triple check for us first; that's been said a dozen times, and there's always been some difference that got forgotten)

There was one minor difference (I always optimize also for elixirs/food) which was the type of food. However, the scores still don't match. *All* I changed between saving was to remove items/gems/enchants that I was fairly certain were not in that one great result.

Here's the corrected manual-equip file. If you can find other settings I changed, I'll be happy to crawl into a corner, self-flagellate, and cry.

This is similar to what I'm seeing:  
* Run optimization get score of X in Optimizer UI.
* Load optimized gear, UI shows score of Y where Y < X

I've seen this most readily in DPSDK because the shift is sometimes dramatic 10-11k in Optimizer and 8-9k in the base UI.  I haven't noticed it in TankDK.  I have a defect up about what I'm seeing in addition to my character file.  These may be dups.
Confirmed, I've seen this happen to DPSWarr

I'm not sure this is the same thing as you guys are talking about. The two different scores I show are both on the main UI, not on the optimizer window. I honestly wasn't double-checking to see if optimizer/main UI matched.

Just load up 707215.xml and messedup_bear2.xml and look at the scores on each. No optimizer run required.

Nevermind, disregard, I'm stupid. Please close this ticket. I missed a trinket.

Any suggestions for self-flagellation devices?
